trial_identification.studytitle: A Randomised Controlled Trial of an Expert Weaning System (SmartcareTM) versus Usual Ventilatory Management in Critical Illness
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A Randomised Controlled Trial of an Expert Weaning System (SmartcareTM) versus Usual Ventilatory Management in Critical Illness

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Research that is not of generic health relevance and not applicable to specific health categories listed above

interventions.interventions: Patients receiving mechanical ventilation for greater than 24 hours who meet the eligibility criteria will be randomised to receive weaning either by the usual care methods existing in the unit or via the SmartcareTM expert weaning system available on the Drager XL ventilators until they are ready for extubation.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Time to extubation (total duration of ventilation)
Use of non-invasive ventilation post extubation

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Patient ventilated on non-spontaneous mode for 24 hoursPaO2/FiO2 > 150 or SaO2 90% with FiO2 .9PEEP 8cm H2OHemodynamically stable (Noradrenaline or Adrenaline less than 1 mg/hr)Body Temperature 36-39Â° CGlasgow coma score >4Stable neurological statusNo immediate requirements for transport or surgeryPass 30-minute pressure support testSmartcareTM enabled ventilator available for use.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Patients with central nervous system disorders (e.g. stroke meningitis, cardiac arrest with neurologic sequelae) or neuromuscular disease (Guillain-Barre syndrome, myasthenia gravis).

trial_design.concealment: Numbered envelopes provided by The Statistical Consulting centre of THe University of Melbourne
trial_design.sequence: Randomisation sequence will be generated by THe Statistical Consulting Centre of The University of Melbourne

sponsorship.primarysponsorname: The Intensive Care Unit of The Royal Melbourne Hospital
